intro: Hieracium sterrochaetium, commonly known as the rough-haired hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has rough, hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is native to parts of Europe and is typically found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium sterrochaetium is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
